General Summary


Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Minimum and Preferred Entrance Qualifications

The growing Channels & Services team focuses on developing and scaling new customer segments and services. Through our professional user program, Circle, we've succeeded in cultivating a large and diverse service provider network, with Squarespace Marketplace we have created a network of independent service providers who help do-it-yourself and do-it-for-me customers succeed online, and we've successfully launched our Enterprise product to support larger business initiatives.

Now, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to support the many facets of the Channels & Services team and collaborate with colleagues across the organization to drive data driven decisions and impact.

You will report to our Business Intelligence Lead based in our NYC office.

All Squarespace employees are working remotely at this time. We are closely monitoring the status of COVID-19 as we continue our work to build a return-to-work plan that ensures a safe return to our offices and provides flexibility for our employees.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Provide insights and own the reporting, data validation, trending, and presenting data in a format that allows the team and management to make strategic decisions

Partner across the business to support Channels & Services programs and growth goals, report on performance, determine measurement approaches, create insights and set strategy for new challenges

Build and expand existing dashboards, surface insights and democratize data access that empower teams to better understand and act on data

Perform exploratory analyses on large volumes of data; extract, package and present recommendations to inform marketing decisions

Identify problems and opportunities through data analysis and help support the teams in developing strategic solutions

QUALIFICATIONS

2+ years experience in an analytics or data-driven role

Experience with SQL, Python, BI reporting (i.e. Chart.io, Looker, Tableau) and databases (dimensional and relational), including data ingestion and transformation

Advanced Excel/google sheets skills including pivots, vlookups, ability to build complex formulas

Experience developing analytical frameworks, metrics to measure ongoing performance and understand performance drivers

Ability to transform data into a digestible and presentable story to technical and non-technical audiences

About Squarespace

Squarespace makes beautiful products to help people with creative ideas succeed. By blending elegant design and sophisticated engineering, we empower millions of people — from individuals and local artists to entrepreneurs shaping the world's most iconic businesses — to share their stories with the world. Squarespace's team of more than 1,300 is headquartered in downtown New York City, with offices in Dublin and Portland. For more information, visit www.squarespace.com/about .

Benefits & Perks

Health insurance with 100% premium covered for you and your dependent children

Flexible vacation & paid time off

Up to 20 weeks of paid family leave

Equity plan for all employees

Retirement benefits with employer match

Fertility and adoption benefits

Free lunch and snacks at all offices

Education reimbursement

Dog-friendly workplace in New York office

Commuter benefit in the form of reduced tax (Ireland) and pretax (US)

Today, more than a million people around the globe use Squarespace to share different perspectives and experiences with the world. Not only do we embrace and celebrate the diversity of our customer base, but we also strive for the same in our employees. At Squarespace, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or other class protected by applicable law. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

The Department of Public Works and Environmental Services, a nationally accredited agency committed to building and maintaining safe, reliable infrastructure that improves public health and provides a high quality of life for residents, is seeking an experienced and innovative business analyst to join the IT services team supporting the Capital Facilities division. An exciting initiative is underway to implement an innovative SaaS capital project management technology, providing an excellent opportunity for a qualified candidate to help modernize processes supporting both customers and employees.

As a member of the team, you will:
Serve as the lead business analyst point of contact to Capital Facilities division and have overall responsibility and accountability for development and delivery of high-quality IT solutions and services.

Your Job
As a Business Analyst, you'll work with various stakeholders at different levels of the organization to assess business needs, gather requirements, and help understand and improve work processes. You’ll need to provide diplomatic and timely communication in an agile-like work environment with iterative planning and delivery cycles. Specifically, you will:

Gain an in-depth knowledge of current processes and business practices through shadowing, interviewing key participants, and maintaining an understanding of the department(s) you support.
Analyze, draft, validate and finalize business and technical requirements.
Proactively examine the change impact of process adjustments on people, strategy, systems and general business operations to determine priority of needs.


We are builders, we are integrators. We create and optimize solutions for a rapidly growing business on a global scale. We work with distributed infrastructure, petabytes of data, and billions of transactions with no limitations on your creativity.

IntegriChain is the data and application backbone for market access departments of Life Sciences manufacturers. We deliver the data, the applications, and the business process infrastructure for patient access and therapy commercialization. ICyte is the first and only platform that unites the financial, operational, and commercial data sets required to support therapy access in the era of specialty and precision medicine. With ICyte, Life Sciences innovators can digitalize their market access operations, freeing up resources to focus on more data-driven decision support. With ICyte, Life Sciences innovators are digitalizing labor-intensive processes – freeing up their best talent to identify and resolve coverage and availability hurdles and to manage pricing and forecasting complexity.

We are headquartered in Philadelphia, PA, with offices in Ambler, PA; Somerset, NJ, Raleigh, NC, and Pune, India. For more information, visit www.integrichain.com, or follow us on Twitter @IntegriChain and LinkedIn.

Collier Trophy. Founded in 1984, the company has redefined performance, comfort and safety in aviation with innovations like the Cirrus Airframe Parachute System® (CAPS®) – the first FAA-certified whole-airframe parachute safety system included as standard equipment on an aircraft. Fanatics is the global leader in licensed sports merchandise and changing the way fans purchase their favorite team apparel and jerseys. Through an innovative, tech-infused approach to making and selling fan gear in today's on-demand culture, Fanatics operates more than 300 online and offline stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, MLS, PGA), and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs (Manchester United, Real Madrid, Chelsea). Pyramid Hotel Group, established in 1999, is a privately owned full-service hotel and resort company based in Boston. We manage over 100 hotels with more than 12,000 team members across the United States, the Caribbean, Ireland and the UK. We are growing, and opportunity abounds.

This is why we deliver superior results.

Title: Business Solutions Analyst
Location: Remote Work
Length: 6 Months+
Job Description:
The Business Solutions Analyst (BSA) works as a liaison between key business stakeholders and the Digital and Human Experience Information Technology (IT) department. BSAs are responsible for working with stakeholders to understand their business needs and working with DHIT partners to implement solutions that meet the business needs, goals, and objectives. BSAs play a critical role in defining business solutions and place particular emphasis on the following:
1. Root Cause/ProblemDefinition - BSAs interface with both the business stakeholders and core DHIT. They improve communication, which leads to defining a clearer understanding of the drivers that created the business problem/opportunity.
2. Cost-Effectiveness - BSAs are internal consultants whose primary responsibility is to drive the organization to the most efficient and cost-effective business decisions.
3. Solution/Protocol- BSAs follow a protocol to elicit and document clear, complete, and comprehensive requirements. They evaluate, define, analyze and document business problems collaborating with appropriate partners to lead to the most appropriate business solution.

The Business Analyst supports Vinfen's mission of providing quality care by developing and presenting analytic reports to provide insight into the performance of current operations throughout the organization. The Business Analyst supports Vinfen's efforts in identifying, manipulating, and analyzing data from a variety of sources for reporting and presenting to both internal and external stakeholders & accreditation bodies. Reporting to the Performance Analytics and Data Manager, the Business Analyst coordinates the data collection and preparation, analysis, and presentation of state required outcomes for reporting.
Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Contributes to Vinfen's operational analytics efforts. Understands the organization's current reporting process and end products and identifies any gaps and redundancies. Works with process end users to fully understand the current data available. Creates ongoing and/or one-time reports to support ongoing operational improvements.

Job Details
Description
We are searching for a Business Analyst who can gather and analyze business requirements while working with project managers. Our ideal candidate would translate business requirements into digestible information, work on multiple projects simultaneously, and work directly with the developers. The candidate would have experience interfacing with managers and developers in a fast-paced environment. This person must take ownership of projects and client relationships from proposal through delivery and make sure that the engagement is successful. The right candidate has some type of technical background, a willingness to learn (or know) SQL, and bring a sense of focus to everyone involved in the projects.

OSU Physicians, Inc.
We believe that being engaged and sharing in a larger purpose at work is instrumental to the employee experience. “Tradition, iconic, determination, teamwork, competitive, purpose, compassion, community, pride, integrity.” These are words that our employees use to describe what it feels like to embody the “Buckeye Spirit” and work for our organization. Sound like something you are seeking? We invite you to keep reading.

Located throughout Central Ohio serving as the clinical service arm of one of America’s top-ranked academic medical centers, OSU Physicians, Inc. fosters an environment built on diversity, employee development and quality patient care. At our organization, we value inclusiveness, determination, empathy, sincerity, ownership and innovation by leading the charge toward a better future through the power of connection.
Our vision is to push the boundaries of discovery and knowledge to solve significant health problems and deliver unparalleled care to our patients. Apply now and work together with us to make a greater impact on our society in which we serve.

Company Overview

Fanatics is the global leader in licensed sports merchandise and changing the way fans purchase their favorite team apparel and jerseys. Through an innovative, tech-infused approach to making and selling fan gear in today's on-demand culture, Fanatics operates more than 300 online and offline stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, MLS, PGA), and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs (Manchester United, Real Madrid, Chelsea). Fanatics offers the largest collection of timeless and timely merchandise whether shopping online, on your phone, in stores, in stadiums or on-site at the world's biggest sporting events. At Fanatics, we’re a diverse, passionate group of employees aiming to ignite pride and passion in the fans we outfit, celebrate and support. We recognize that diversity helps drive and foster innovation, and through our IDEA program (inclusion, diversity, equality and advocacy) at Fanatics we provide employees with tools and resources to feel connected and engaged in who they are and what they do to support the ultimate fan experience.

Business Process Analyst -UND0003N9
Description

Job Summary

Under broad supervision provides process and project support to the business in the development of on-going process and policy assessment evaluation improvement and compliance to support business initiatives and strategies.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Assists with the development and compliance of policies and procedures for the business to ensure consistent implementation and improve efficiency cost-effectiveness and/or internal and external customer service. Understands the business needs and consults and partners with business leaders in helping to plan projects and programs.
Participates in the analysis and decision support to help the business deliver on key business priorities. Interacts and collaborates with multiple disciplines to gather information perform analysis and assist with making recommendations to management to drive continuous improvement.
Provides input in defining process performance measures determines data availability advises operational reporting group of required measures and helps with developing methods and tools to track process performance.
Assists with developing process-related training programs including creating workflow job aids training materials and presentations related to internal and external learning opportunities. Evaluates alternatives and external training.
Partners with the appropriate team for building and maintaining centralized processing documentation. Evaluates content for reference library for their area of responsibility. Maintains inventory of business process methodologies and approach. Documents business processes by applying and promoting process modeling best practices.
May assist other business project managers for process improvement projects including assisting IT with setting requirements participating in user acceptance testing and documenting processes.
May work with business partners across organization to improve how operations metrics are gathered stored and analyzed. Helps prepare operations finance and statistical reports using relevant internal and external data.

The NACT Operations team is seeking a Junior analyst to help design and innovative rapid business intelligence solutions and analytical insight that support internal business and executive teams with essential information for more informed decisions.

This Junior analyst role will be focused on translating statistical and analytical data in ways that are optimized for our sales leaders and business management teams, spanning the North-America Cloud and Technology business. This role will be responsible for turning complex data into clear and concise information for our Consulting and partner businesses.

1+ years of experience designing and implementing high-performance, simple analytic solutions

Deep experience using Oracle Analytics Cloud or similar for ad-hoc analysis and dashboards

Experience with data visualization methodologies and frameworks

Experience with web technologies is a plus

Proficient in SQL

Experience working with big data

Outstanding written, verbal, and presentation skills with the ability to develop and present conclusions and recommendation to senior executives

Able to work effectively on sometimes ambiguous data and constructs within a fast changing environment, tight deadlines and priority changes

Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time

Highly motivated and responsible for self-learning

Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.

Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.

Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. Attention to detail critical. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. Relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact with management and possible clients desired. 2 plus years relevant work experience.If you are a Colorado resident, Please

or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 104321 in the subject line of the email.

Job Details
Description
We are searching for a Business Analyst who can gather and analyze business requirements while working with project managers. Our ideal candidate would translate business requirements into digestible information, work on multiple projects simultaneously, and work directly with the developers. The candidate would have experience interfacing with managers and developers in a fast-paced environment. Experience with development methodologies, especially Agile (Scrum), and Jira as the Issues and Project Management tool a plus.
The Business Analyst would bridge the gap between internal clients and the project teams by understanding both the business challenges and technical requirements. This person must take ownership of projects and client relationships from proposal through delivery and make sure that the engagement is successful. The right candidate has some type of technical background, a willingness to learn (or know) SQL, and bring a sense of focus to everyone involved in the projects.

ADMINISTRATION
Full-time
Business Operations Analyst
Santa Monica
United States

The Business Operations Analyst (Defensive Line) will provide strategic analysis and mission critical project management at a regional leadership level. The role will require leadership in the development and implementation of high impact projects across all departments, ensuring proper alignment of deliverables and allocation of resources. This individual will develop relationships across all levels and local geographies to monitor and maintain the cultural pulse of the region. The role requires both strategic framing and project execution.

33 Mile Radius, an EverCommerce company, is looking for a Business Analyst to join our team. The Business Analyst will play a crucial role in supporting the entire executive team, and other key stakeholders in a variety of projects, including KPI development, analysis, and tracking; executive-level reporting/visualization; data infrastructure buildouts across a diverse portfolio of businesses; and deep one-off operational analyses.
You:
You are a collaborative, enthusiastic, high-performing individual with a “no job too small” attitude.
You’re seeking a steep learning curve, driven by deadlines, and enjoy working in a fast-paced, continually changing environment with other like-minded individuals.

POSITION PURPOSE:
The Business Analyst position is responsible for report building, and workflow automation. This individual serves as a technical point-of-contact for assigned functional areas, and assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report building, and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. In addition, provides data analysis and analytical support for projects and cost savings initiatives. The Analyst will support all program initiatives and maintain financial benefit tracking.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Write, maintain, and support a variety of reports and queries utilizing appropriate reporting tools. Assist in development of standard reports for ongoing customer needs. Help maintain data integrity in systems by running queries and analyzing data.

TD Description
About TD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank®
TD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank, is one of the 10 largest banks in the U.S., providing more than 8 million customers with a full range of retail, small business and commercial banking products and services at approximately 1,300 convenient locations throughout the Northeast, Mid-Atlantic, Metro D.C., the Carolinas and Florida. In addition, TD Bank and its subsidiaries offer customized private banking and wealth management services through TD Wealth®, and vehicle financing and dealer commercial services through TD Auto Finance. TD Bank is headquartered in Cherry Hill, N.J.
TD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank, is a member of TD Bank Group and a subsidiary of The Toronto-Dominion Bank of Toronto, Canada, a top 10 financial services company in North America. The Toronto-Dominion Bank trades on the New York and Toronto stock exchanges under the ticker symbol "TD".

Description:
Operations Business Analyst who is responsible for ensuring all financial data and reporting related to Life Science Integrated Supply Chain Operations, Quality, and Technical CapEx is accurate and easily accessible to the Operations Controlling team. The objective for this position will be to streamline information and provide the Operations Controlling team with easy access to data at the time when it is needed and in the format which it is needed while maintaining a high degree of data integrity. This reporting and data management are critical for divisional management decision making, business monitoring, and strategy development. This position will provide support for reporting process development and be the key participant in reporting tool development and enhancement.
Position Responsibilities
Responsible for creation and streamlining of critical reporting in support of Operations & Quality Controlling teams to facilitate the delivery of timely and accurate financial information for the following key reports:
Monthly Gross Margin reporting
Operations Gross Expenditure Reporting
Operations Support & Global Quality month end reporting
Global Technical CapEx reporting – Significant level of ad hoc financial modeling and reporting requirements as well as standard monthly reporting.
The position will be responsible for managing all data inputs as well as business partnering with Controlling and Functional support, and ensuring data integrity for the following key systems/areas:
Operations Reporting Cube – Mfg. Site Data – Responsible for working with local Site Controlling to ensure that all quantitative and qualitative metrics are uploaded in a timely fashion and costs are accurately reflected per the Group Controlling Guideline. This position will have the critical responsibility to understand and be able to access data across multiple ERP systems globally while influencing the accounting logic.
Technical CapEx – Responsible for managing all data inputs related to forecasting of Technical CapEx globally including the creation and management of Master Data globally and assisting in the coordination of the forecasting process with global Controlling partners.
Prepares additional complex ad hoc analyses as required and presenting recommendations to senior Controlling management. Provides Management organization with all necessary consolidated information in a timely and accurate manner.

Who You Are
The Business Operations Analyst uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve processes, policies, services, and practices. He/She is responsible for maintaining the pricing, discounting, and incentive data to ensure correct pricing and discounting is applied in the ordering tools. The individual will serve as point of contact for managing, tracking, reporting and resolving issues with the pricing and discounting data. What You'll Do
Perform data analysis using specialized domain knowledge and developed business expertise
Develop and lead business analysis programs, initiatives, and activities
Identify problems that impact ability to deliver, ability to achieve margins, or are areas of inconsistency in the business
Develop recommendations for new business processes and adaption of business tools in support of changes
Cross functional collaboration required to execute on tasks The right candidate should have the ability to:
Solve a range of problems and explain logic or decisions to others
Analyze multiple sources of information and evaluate several alternative solutions before confirming path forward
Exchange ideas, content, and explain information in a clear and effective manner
Understand Cisco business model – know how Cisco sells, the Cisco product portfolio and GTM strategies
Interpret large raw data sets; conduct data analysis and audits – high level of Excel mastery (Macros, Pivots, Formulas and Slicing), ability to work through large data and understand reporting
Use reporting tools, download data, and analyse data
Communicate effectively with excellent communication skills, bold, assertive and possess a sense of ownership of the assigned tasks
Work independently and in a cross functional team environment Eligibility & Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree


2 years of overall analyst experience (mandatory)
1 year of relevant experience (desirable)
Highly organized with strong analytical and problem solving skills
Responsive and timely in delivering on commitments
Knowledgeable in process and change management
Positive attitude and strong work ethic
Knowledge of Cisco products and services (desired) Who You'll Work With
The Business Operations Analyst works with internal Cisco stakeholders to support setup and maintenance of operational ordering setups.

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Overview
Varonis is a world-class organization with a straightforward mission: protecting vulnerable data.
Did you know that on average, 20% of an organization's data is accessible to every employee? Seventy percent of attacks take months or years to discover. But not for our customers.
At Varonis, we see the world of cybersecurity differently.
Our customers always know where their most valuable data is – on premises or in the cloud. Only the right people have access to only the right data. With real-time awareness of how employees use data, our clients flag and stop malicious behavior in its tracks.
We’re fighting a different battle than conventional cybersecurity companies, relentlessly focused on securing data. Data assets are the most valuable – and vulnerable – components of the global economy. Along with employees, data is at the heart of almost every organization, yet conventional cybersecurity solutions, by themselves, have failed to protect it.

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Description

Job Summary

Under broad supervision provides process and project support to the business in the development of on-going process and policy assessment evaluation improvement and compliance to support business initiatives and strategies.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Assists with the development and compliance of policies and procedures for the business to ensure consistent implementation and improve efficiency cost-effectiveness and/or internal and external customer service. Understands the business needs and consults and partners with business leaders in helping to plan projects and programs.
Participates in the analysis and decision support to help the business deliver on key business priorities. Interacts and collaborates with multiple disciplines to gather information perform analysis and assist with making recommendations to management to drive continuous improvement.
Provides input in defining process performance measures determines data availability advises operational reporting group of required measures and helps with developing methods and tools to track process performance.
Assists with developing process-related training programs including creating workflow job aids training materials and presentations related to internal and external learning opportunities. Evaluates alternatives and external training.
Partners with the appropriate team for building and maintaining centralized processing documentation. Evaluates content for reference library for their area of responsibility. Maintains inventory of business process methodologies and approach. Documents business processes by applying and promoting process modeling best practices.
May assist other business project managers for process improvement projects including assisting IT with setting requirements participating in user acceptance testing and documenting processes.
May work with business partners across organization to improve how operations metrics are gathered stored and analyzed. Helps prepare operations finance and statistical reports using relevant internal and external data.

World Education Services (WES) is a non-profit social enterprise dedicated to helping international students, immigrants, and refugees achieve their educational and career goals in the U.S. and Canada. WES evaluates international educational qualifications, supports the integration of immigrants into the workforce, and provides philanthropic funding to immigrant-serving organizations. Since 1974, WES has provided credential evaluations to nearly three million individuals from more than 200 countries.
Through WES Global Talent Bridge, the organization helps immigrants and refugees who hold international credentials fully utilize their talents and education. Its philanthropic arm, the WES Mariam Assefa Fund, supports inclusive economies that help immigrants and refugees thrive in the United States and Canada.

Technical/Functional Skills
The Business Analyst job family defines skills for formulating and defining system scope using information technology and industry knowledge/requirements, based on both user needs and a good understanding of information technology, business processes, and industry requirements. The job progression identifies responsibilities ranging from assisting, formulating and defining systems scope and objectives to self-directed activities that result in client’s long term improvements in business processes. About Us
LTSE supports companies in all stages of growth committed to long-term value creation, and the investors who share their values. We offer software and services for company-building and pursuing a path to the public markets, a U.S. national securities exchange for new and existing public companies, and a coalition for the exchange of ideas between companies and like-minded investors.

We believe in the power of a public market that supports continuous success for all stakeholders, including employees, investors, and their communities. We’re helping innovation and value creation flourish for now and far into the future through long-term investment, experimentation, and sustainable scaling.

Lead LTSE investors include Founders Fund, Collaborative Fund, Andreessen Horowitz, Obvious Ventures, Uprising, and Initialized. LTSE was founded by Eric Ries, an entrepreneur, New York Times-best-selling author, and the creator of the Lean Startup methodology.

Who You Are

The individual will serve as point of contact for managing, tracking, reporting and resolving issues with the pricing and discounting data. What You'll Do
Perform data analysis using specialized domain knowledge and developed business expertise

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Description:
Operations Business Analyst who is responsible for ensuring all financial data and reporting related to Life Science Integrated Supply Chain Operations, Quality, and Technical CapEx is accurate and easily accessible to the Operations Controlling team. The objective for this position will be to streamline information and provide the Operations Controlling team with easy access to data at the time when it is needed and in the format which it is needed while maintaining a high degree of data integrity. This reporting and data management are critical for divisional management decision making, business monitoring, and strategy development. This position will provide support for reporting process development and be the key participant in reporting tool development and enhancement.
Position Responsibilities
Responsible for creation and streamlining of critical reporting in support of Operations & Quality Controlling teams to facilitate the delivery of timely and accurate financial information for the following key reports:
Monthly Gross Margin reporting
Operations Gross Expenditure Reporting
Operations Support & Global Quality month end reporting
Global Technical CapEx reporting – Significant level of ad hoc financial modeling and reporting requirements as well as standard monthly reporting.
The position will be responsible for managing all data inputs as well as business partnering with Controlling and Functional support, and ensuring data integrity for the following key systems/areas:
Operations Reporting Cube – Mfg. Site Data – Responsible for working with local Site Controlling to ensure that all quantitative and qualitative metrics are uploaded in a timely fashion and costs are accurately reflected per the Group Controlling Guideline. This position will have the critical responsibility to understand and be able to access data across multiple ERP systems globally while influencing the accounting logic.
Technical CapEx – Responsible for managing all data inputs related to forecasting of Technical CapEx globally including the creation and management of Master Data globally and assisting in the coordination of the forecasting process with global Controlling partners.
Prepares additional complex ad hoc analyses as required and presenting recommendations to senior Controlling management. Provides Management organization with all necessary consolidated information in a timely and accurate manner.

Overview:
At Valence, we are all about building potential. That goes for our clients as well as our team members. Our mission is to help our customers advance their digital transformation journey and we are looking for a Business Analyst to join our team.

Are you passionate about exploring new and emerging technologies and how they can be used to solve challenging problems? If so, then this may be the right opportunity for you. As a Business Analyst at Valence, you will work alongside a group of talented engineers, project managers and analysts defining and implementing end-to-end, leading-edge solutions for our enterprise clients. With Valence, you can work in a collaborative environment where you can influence direction and see the impacts of your contributions. We love to innovate and are looking for people with a passion for learning and growing their technical skills.

In this role, you will:
Assist in goal setting thru the building of accurate program targets & forecasts, supporting reporting and insights in line with forecasts, helping derive actionable insights to manage positive changes in business.

Weekly reporting on key performance indicators for run of business with key insights and actions.

Advise on reporting capabilities for new projects, including innovation releases (launch of new capabilities), and campaigns/product launches. Devise and build reporting plans and drive execution of plans to deliver on reporting needs.

Proactively identify issues in data sources (Power BI, Live Engage, MSX, Adobe Analytics) and partner with appropriate teams to resolve.

Perform market research and stay apprised of digital sales and support trends to inform new business strategies.

derive insights for leadership from the data, understand how it impacts the nuances of the business more than the general consulting recommendations.

Leverage multiple data visualization techniques to land the primary soundbite leaders need to take away, using multiple different methods: PowerPoint, Excel, PowerBI, etc.

Partners with multiple individuals across the organization to gather insight into new data sources, ensure that data is pulled correct, or to drive adoption of a new standard KPI/report.


7+ years working in quantitative or analytical role.

previous experience using Adobe Analytics and Power BI

experience in leveraging PowerPoint and Excel

Ideal candidate would have an eCommerce sales or marketing measurement background.

WHAT WILL MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL AT VALENCE?

Self-starter and independent worker

Must be comfortable with a fast moving, ever-changing environment.

Detail oriented to ensure storytelling skills.

Professional communication skills, including providing status updates to the client.

Successful interacting with multiple stakeholders across organization

You have a passion for innovation and technology. You have a sense of humor. You believe in the potential in everyone. You are ego-free. You're collaborative and value a work culture where great ideas can come from anyone.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Description

Job Summary

Under broad supervision provides process and project support to the business in the development of on-going process and policy assessment evaluation improvement and compliance to support business initiatives and strategies.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Assists with the development and compliance of policies and procedures for the business to ensure consistent implementation and improve efficiency cost-effectiveness and/or internal and external customer service. Understands the business needs and consults and partners with business leaders in helping to plan projects and programs.
Participates in the analysis and decision support to help the business deliver on key business priorities. Interacts and collaborates with multiple disciplines to gather information perform analysis and assist with making recommendations to management to drive continuous improvement.
Provides input in defining process performance measures determines data availability advises operational reporting group of required measures and helps with developing methods and tools to track process performance.
Assists with developing process-related training programs including creating workflow job aids training materials and presentations related to internal and external learning opportunities. Evaluates alternatives and external training.
Partners with the appropriate team for building and maintaining centralized processing documentation. Evaluates content for reference library for their area of responsibility. The Company You’ll Join
At Carta we create owners and make private markets liquid.
We live in a world where some people live on the equity stack and enjoy exponential wealth growth and preferential tax treatment; others live on the debt stack and may work their entire lives for a company and retire only with the cash they’ve managed to save from their paychecks. Our contribution to solving the wealth inequality problem is moving people from the debt stack (payroll) to the equity stack. By making it as easy to issue equity to employees as it is to put them on payroll, we can create more owners.
At Carta, we are helpful, transparent, fair, and kind. We are relentless executors, unconventional thinkers, and masters of our craft.

The growing Channels & Services team focuses on developing and scaling new customer segments and services. Through our professional user program, Circle, we've succeeded in cultivating a large and diverse service provider network, with Squarespace Marketplace we have created a network of independent service providers who help do-it-yourself and do-it-for-me customers succeed online, and we've successfully launched our Enterprise product to support larger business initiatives.

Now, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to support the many facets of the Channels & Services team and collaborate with colleagues across the organization to drive data driven decisions and impact.

You will report to our Business Intelligence Lead based in our NYC office.

All Squarespace employees are working remotely at this time. We are closely monitoring the status of COVID-19 as we continue our work to build a return-to-work plan that ensures a safe return to our offices and provides flexibility for our employees.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Provide insights and own the reporting, data validation, trending, and presenting data in a format that allows the team and management to make strategic decisions

Partner across the business to support Channels & Services programs and growth goals, report on performance, determine measurement approaches, create insights and set strategy for new challenges

Build and expand existing dashboards, surface insights and democratize data access that empower teams to better understand and act on data

Perform exploratory analyses on large volumes of data; extract, package and present recommendations to inform marketing decisions

Identify problems and opportunities through data analysis and help support the teams in developing strategic solutions

QUALIFICATIONS

2+ years experience in an analytics or data-driven role

Experience with SQL, Python, BI reporting (i.e. Chart.io, Looker, Tableau) and databases (dimensional and relational), including data ingestion and transformation

Advanced Excel/google sheets skills including pivots, vlookups, ability to build complex formulas

Experience developing analytical frameworks, metrics to measure ongoing performance and understand performance drivers

Ability to transform data into a digestible and presentable story to technical and non-technical audiences

Description
We are searching for a Business Analyst who can gather and analyze business requirements while working with project managers. Our ideal candidate would translate business requirements into digestible information, work on multiple projects simultaneously, and work directly with the developers. The right candidate has some type of technical background, a willingness to learn (or know) SQL, and bring a sense of focus to everyone involved in the projects.

Who You Are
The Business Operations Analyst uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve processes, policies, services, and practices. He/She is responsible for maintaining the pricing, discounting, and incentive data to ensure correct pricing and discounting is applied in the ordering tools. The individual will serve as point of contact for managing, tracking, reporting and resolving issues with the pricing and discounting data. What You'll Do
Perform data analysis using specialized domain knowledge and developed business expertise
Develop and lead business analysis programs, initiatives, and activities
Identify problems that impact ability to deliver, ability to achieve margins, or are areas of inconsistency in the business
Develop recommendations for new business processes and adaption of business tools in support of changes
Cross functional collaboration required to execute on tasks The right candidate should have the ability to:
Solve a range of problems and explain logic or decisions to others
Analyze multiple sources of information and evaluate several alternative solutions before confirming path forward
Exchange ideas, content, and explain information in a clear and effective manner
Understand Cisco business model – know how Cisco sells, the Cisco product portfolio and GTM strategies
Interpret large raw data sets; conduct data analysis and audits – high level of Excel mastery (Macros, Pivots, Formulas and Slicing), ability to work through large data and understand reporting
Use reporting tools, download data, and analyse data
Communicate effectively with excellent communication skills, bold, assertive and possess a sense of ownership of the assigned tasks
Work independently and in a cross functional team environment Eligibility & Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree


2 years of overall analyst experience (mandatory)
1 year of relevant experience (desirable)
Highly organized with strong analytical and problem solving skills
Responsive and timely in delivering on commitments
Knowledgeable in process and change management
Positive attitude and strong work ethic
Knowledge of Cisco products and services (desired) Who You'll Work With
The Business Operations Analyst works with internal Cisco stakeholders to support setup and maintenance of operational ordering setups.

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

EverCommerce is looking for a Business Analyst to join our team. The Business Analyst will play a key role and support the VP of Strategic Planning & Analytics, General Managers, Executive Team, and other key stakeholders in a variety of projects, including KPI development, analysis and tracking, executive-level reporting/visualization, data infrastructure build across a diverse portfolio of businesses, and deep one-off operational analyses.
You:
You are a collaborative, enthusiastic, high-performing individual with a “no job too small” attitude. You’re driven by deadlines and enjoy working in a fast paced, continually changing environment with other like-minded individuals. You love teams but also enjoy putting your head down and getting things done with your headphones on. You are highly self-motivated and can initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance because you have confidence to ask questions and work independently.

The growing Channels & Services team focuses on developing and scaling new customer segments and services. Through our professional user program, Circle, we've succeeded in cultivating a large and diverse service provider network, with Squarespace Marketplace we have created a network of independent service providers who help do-it-yourself and do-it-for-me customers succeed online, and we've successfully launched our Enterprise product to support larger business initiatives.

Now, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to support the many facets of the Channels & Services team and collaborate with colleagues across the organization to drive data driven decisions and impact.

You will report to our Business Intelligence Lead based in our NYC office.

All Squarespace employees are working remotely at this time. We are closely monitoring the status of COVID-19 as we continue our work to build a return-to-work plan that ensures a safe return to our offices and provides flexibility for our employees.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Provide insights and own the reporting, data validation, trending, and presenting data in a format that allows the team and management to make strategic decisions

Partner across the business to support Channels & Services programs and growth goals, report on performance, determine measurement approaches, create insights and set strategy for new challenges

Build and expand existing dashboards, surface insights and democratize data access that empower teams to better understand and act on data

Perform exploratory analyses on large volumes of data; extract, package and present recommendations to inform marketing decisions

Identify problems and opportunities through data analysis and help support the teams in developing strategic solutions

QUALIFICATIONS

2+ years experience in an analytics or data-driven role

Experience with SQL, Python, BI reporting (i.e. Chart.io, Looker, Tableau) and databases (dimensional and relational), including data ingestion and transformation

Advanced Excel/google sheets skills including pivots, vlookups, ability to build complex formulas

Experience developing analytical frameworks, metrics to measure ongoing performance and understand performance drivers

Ability to transform data into a digestible and presentable story to technical and non-technical audiences

About Squarespace

Squarespace makes beautiful products to help people with creative ideas succeed. By blending elegant design and sophisticated engineering, we empower millions of people — from individuals and local artists to entrepreneurs shaping the world's most iconic businesses — to share their stories with the world. Squarespace's team of more than 1,300 is headquartered in downtown New York City, with offices in Dublin and Portland. For more information, visit www.squarespace.com/about .

Benefits & Perks

Health insurance with 100% premium covered for you and your dependent children

Flexible vacation & paid time off

Up to 20 weeks of paid family leave

Equity plan for all employees

Retirement benefits with employer match

Fertility and adoption benefits

Free lunch and snacks at all offices

Education reimbursement

Dog-friendly workplace in New York office

Commuter benefit in the form of reduced tax (Ireland) and pretax (US)

Today, more than a million people around the globe use Squarespace to share different perspectives and experiences with the world. Not only do we embrace and celebrate the diversity of our customer base, but we also strive for the same in our employees. At Squarespace, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or other class protected by applicable law. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Operations Associate
Overview
Varonis is a world-class organization with a straightforward mission: protecting vulnerable data.
Did you know that on average, 20% of an organization's data is accessible to every employee? Seventy percent of attacks take months or years to discover. But not for our customers.
At Varonis, we see the world of cybersecurity differently.
Our customers always know where their most valuable data is – on premises or in the cloud. Only the right people have access to only the right data. With real-time awareness of how employees use data, our clients flag and stop malicious behavior in its tracks.
We’re fighting a different battle than conventional cybersecurity companies, relentlessly focused on securing data. Data assets are the most valuable – and vulnerable – components of the global economy. Along with employees, data is at the heart of almost every organization, yet conventional cybersecurity solutions, by themselves, have failed to protect it.

Remote for now, require 100% onsite after COVID

Business Process Analyst -UND0003N9
Description

Job Summary

Under broad supervision provides process and project support to the business in the development of on-going process and policy assessment evaluation improvement and compliance to support business initiatives and strategies.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Assists with the development and compliance of policies and procedures for the business to ensure consistent implementation and improve efficiency cost-effectiveness and/or internal and external customer service. Understands the business needs and consults and partners with business leaders in helping to plan projects and programs.
Participates in the analysis and decision support to help the business deliver on key business priorities. Interacts and collaborates with multiple disciplines to gather information perform analysis and assist with making recommendations to management to drive continuous improvement.
Provides input in defining process performance measures determines data availability advises operational reporting group of required measures and helps with developing methods and tools to track process performance.
Assists with developing process-related training programs including creating workflow job aids training materials and presentations related to internal and external learning opportunities. Evaluates alternatives and external training.
Partners with the appropriate team for building and maintaining centralized processing documentation. Evaluates content for reference library for their area of responsibility. Maintains inventory of business process methodologies and approach. Documents business processes by applying and promoting process modeling best practices.
May assist other business project managers for process improvement projects including assisting IT with setting requirements participating in user acceptance testing and documenting processes.
May work with business partners across organization to improve how operations metrics are gathered stored and analyzed. Helps prepare operations finance and statistical reports using relevant internal and external data.

Responsibilities:

About the role:
The Business Operations Analyst will directly support one of Enova's core businesses and work on projects focused on monitoring and supervision across our products. Enova offers a variety of products across different states and each product - state combination comes with unique regulatory and business needs. The analyst will work cross functionally with different groups of the business on aligning business and compliance requirements, identifying and preventing customer incidents, and collaborating on customer remediations.

What you'll be doing:
Understand, document and become subject matter expert of product offerings, brand and state compliance matrix, product transactional logic, funding and payment processes

Support customer complaint escalation process and complaint data analysis. Recommended process improvements based on observed trends

Develop new and improved monitoring infrastructure to ensure product, technology, and process compliance with internal and regulatory guidelines

Detect production or compliance exceptions, determine impact to business and customers, resolve such exceptions or escalate to management team if needed

Support ad hoc data requests for external / third party business audits


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business, or Finance

1 -2 years of experience in a related field

Skilled in SQL, Python, Excel

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills

Being able to work in a team environment and independently

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Familiarity with Microstrategy, Grafana, and other monitoring dashboards is a plus


Enova's Strategy & Operation teams - or "S&O" as insiders commonly refer to them here - drive the business at both the operational and business levels. In addition to working cross functionally on the corporate side, S&Os work closely with our call center operations (think application support, loan processing, collections or customer service) to ensure optimization and anticipate any bumps in the road. To do this, they dive deeper into our existing processes and ask themselves lots of questions like, why are we doing this that way? Why don't we try this? And, likely the most important question, how is this going to affect the bottom line of our business?


Enova is a leading financial technology company providing online financial services through its AI and machine learning powered lending platform. Enova serves the needs of non-prime consumers and small businesses, who are frequently underserved by traditional banks. Enova has provided more than 7 million customers with over $40 billion in loans and financing with market leading products that provide a path for them to improve their financial health. Want to learn more? Just ask any of our almost 1,500 employees.

Our goal at Enova, we believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all persons and not discriminate in employment decisions by placing the most qualified person in each job, without regard to any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. column2: Business Operations Analyst - Flexible Work Locations
column4:
At ICF, we work on projects that have an impact on real people. From ensuring families have a house that will survive the next hurricane, to helping curb teen vaping, to keeping our nation safe from cybersecurity threats, and more - ICFers are changemakers who do work with purpose.
As a member of the Operations Team the Business Operations Analyst will support the Contracts & Administration (C&A) Group, which includes the functional areas of Contracts, Pricing, Subcontracts, Purchasing, International Operations, Travel, Events, Security, Safety, Real Estate and Facilities. Common tasks include working with stakeholders across the group to assist with C&A responsibilities , managing communications to support awareness and cross functional alignment, helping to derive business-critical insights through analysis of data and issues, contributing to short-term and long-term projects, and supporting international project pursuits and operations.
Working at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth. If you’re seeking to make a difference in the world, visit www.icf.com/careers to find your next career. ICF—together for tomorrow.

Fairfax, VA (VA01)

Job Details
Description
We are searching for a Business Analyst who can gather and analyze business requirements while working with project managers. Our ideal candidate would translate business requirements into digestible information, work on multiple projects simultaneously, and work directly with the developers. The candidate would have experience interfacing with managers and developers in a fast-paced environment. Experience with development methodologies, especially Agile (Scrum), and Jira as the Issues and Project Management tool a plus.
The Business Analyst would bridge the gap between internal clients and the project teams by understanding both the business challenges and technical requirements. This person must take ownership of projects and client relationships from proposal through delivery and make sure that the engagement is successful. The right candidate has some type of technical background, a willingness to learn (or know) SQL, and bring a sense of focus to everyone involved in the projects.

Requisition ID: 44235
Whirlpool Corporation (NYSE: WHR) is the world’s leading kitchen and laundry appliance company, with approximately $19 billion in annual sales, 78,000 employees and 57 manufacturing and technology research centers in 2020. The company markets Whirlpool, KitchenAid, Maytag, Consul, Brastemp, Amana, Bauknecht, JennAir, Indesit and other major brand names in nearly every country throughout the world.
Whirlpool Corporation is consistently recognized by FORTUNE as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies. Our values are the driving force behind everything we do. Integrity, Respect, Inclusion & Diversity, One Whirlpool, and Spirit of Winning propel our teams to excellence. Get to know us and see what it's like to be part of a company that is in constant pursuit of improving life at home.

In Finance, we work hand-in-hand with leaders across the company to ensure smooth, disciplined execution of strategic business objectives. Our Accounting team builds scalable, controlled processes and products for Global Accounting, Treasury, and FinTech that enable our business to operate efficiently.
About the Role
This role is responsible for ensuring Uber Freight's Billing process operates as efficiently as possible. The successful candidate will be responsible for implementing all billing processes and controls, ensuring the BPO processes are maintained, invoice submissions are correct, timely, and accurate. In addition to owning Uber's AR onboarding process for new shippers. The role will also work on payment options and collections for large freight customers.

POSITION SUMMARY
The business analyst will focus on understanding the business operations and process in relation to the financial support area of the US Autoforce Division. They will work closely with the business unit and technology group team to address the tactical day-to-day aspects of discovering, validating, documenting and communicating business-process-related knowledge through modeling, simulating and analyzing current and future states. This will include a heavy focus on mapping and implementing these processes in the businesses new D365 / ERP platform.

POSITION SUMMARY:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through faster, more accurate diagnostic tests. As a member of our team, you’ll get to make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop rapid groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges.

Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics – from ideation and innovation through development and delivery of life-changing advancements in healthcare-associated infections, sexual health, critical infectious disease, virology, and oncology applications.

As part of the Danaher family of companies, our work at Cepheid is supported by a global science and technology innovator. In addition to Danaher’s unrivaled leadership training and professional development programs, this relationship also provides expanded career opportunities across industries and brands. Together, we are united by a shared purpose: Helping Realize Life’s Potential.

The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for helping to establish data-driven decisions by developing, maintaining, and optimizing both business and financial analytics for Customer Care, Americas. The Business Data Analyst will work with partners across the business to help ensure data drives decision making. This is for a high growth company, with rapidly changing priorities and opportunities for continuous improvement. The position requires a person who can manage multiple data activities, and demonstrate flexibility, holistic thinking, time prioritization, and is capable of effectively influencing a variety of stakeholders across the organization.


Become a Subject Matter Expert for our operational data (SFDC, SAP, etc.) by learning and understanding the business, sourcing accurate data, and developing both prescriptive and predictive analytics to help identify and resolve business challenges.
Partner with business leaders to identify, define, develop, and automate key performance metrics that will power data-centered decision making to help us continuously improve.
Build, maintain, and optimize analytical dashboards and models by connecting the dots between large data sets from multiple sources (financial and operational) to deliver actionable business insights and drive business decision-making.
Identify and design process improvements in the organization; automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery/integrity, etc.
Be an innovation advocate to improve the delivery of data to our partners – including making suggestions for the creation of new business dashboards/analytical tools and the refinement of current dashboards for improved data integrity.
Obtaining data from multiple sources, analyze it, and effectively present the data to support or suggest different business objectives
Collaborate closely with other data-focused team members to develop and execute an organizational data strategy.
Ensure effective communications with stakeholders, using a variety of tools and channels
Work independently and confidently handle multiple time-sensitive requests
Other duties as assigned

(REQUIRED)
Complete all assigned and required training satisfactorily and on time


Bachelor’s degree in field with 3-5 years of experience in finance, data analytics, or related field
Knowledge and Skills
Ability to function under pressure and high paced environment – Team player with excellent interpersonal skills, self-motivated, energetic, “can-do” attitude in a fast-moving environment
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Advanced Excel skills with ability to understand and use applied statistics and predictive analytics on complex data sets to solve business problems as well as recommend strategic direction
Experience using data to identify and drive problem solving efforts for operational improvements
Understand data architecture, mapping of data sources and data definitions to ensure quality inputs to analytical solutions.
Proven ability to adapt to change, manage and prioritize work, and communicate effectively in a remote work environment
Proven ability to quickly build trusted relationships across an organization, from SMEs up to Directors, and peers outside of the organization
Ability to learn quickly and pick up tools, systems, and processes in a short amount of time
Experience participating in or leading continuous improvement activities, utilizing structured continuous improvement methodologies (Six Sigma, Problem Solving, Kaizen, and Gemba Walks)


Experience with Einstein Analytics / SFDC to analyze and visualize data reporting
Experience with Power BI or other Business Intelligence/Data Analytics tools

As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

If you're interested in the position, here are a few things you'll get to do and the qualifications that will make you successful in this role.

Who You Are
The Business Operations Analyst uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve processes, policies, services, and practices. He/She is responsible for maintaining the pricing, discounting, and incentive data to ensure correct pricing and discounting is applied in the ordering tools. The individual will serve as point of contact for managing, tracking, reporting and resolving issues with the pricing and discounting data. What You'll Do
Perform data analysis using specialized domain knowledge and developed business expertise
Develop and lead business analysis programs, initiatives, and activities
Identify problems that impact ability to deliver, ability to achieve margins, or are areas of inconsistency in the business
Develop recommendations for new business processes and adaption of business tools in support of changes
Cross functional collaboration required to execute on tasks The right candidate should have the ability to:
Solve a range of problems and explain logic or decisions to others
Analyze multiple sources of information and evaluate several alternative solutions before confirming path forward
Exchange ideas, content, and explain information in a clear and effective manner
Understand Cisco business model – know how Cisco sells, the Cisco product portfolio and GTM strategies
Interpret large raw data sets; conduct data analysis and audits – high level of Excel mastery (Macros, Pivots, Formulas and Slicing), ability to work through large data and understand reporting
Use reporting tools, download data, and analyse data
Communicate effectively with excellent communication skills, bold, assertive and possess a sense of ownership of the assigned tasks
Work independently and in a cross functional team environment Eligibility & Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree


2 years of overall analyst experience (mandatory)
1 year of relevant experience (desirable)
Highly organized with strong analytical and problem solving skills
Responsive and timely in delivering on commitments
Knowledgeable in process and change management
Positive attitude and strong work ethic
Knowledge of Cisco products and services (desired) Who You'll Work With
The Business Operations Analyst works with internal Cisco stakeholders to support setup and maintenance of operational ordering setups.

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Operations Associate
Overview
Varonis is a world-class organization with a straightforward mission: protecting vulnerable data.
Did you know that on average, 20% of an organization's data is accessible to every employee? Seventy percent of attacks take months or years to discover. But not for our customers.
At Varonis, we see the world of cybersecurity differently.
Our customers always know where their most valuable data is – on premises or in the cloud. Only the right people have access to only the right data. With real-time awareness of how employees use data, our clients flag and stop malicious behavior in its tracks.
We’re fighting a different battle than conventional cybersecurity companies, relentlessly focused on securing data. Data assets are the most valuable – and vulnerable – components of the global economy. Along with employees, data is at the heart of almost every organization, yet conventional cybersecurity solutions, by themselves, have failed to protect it.

About the Role
This role is responsible for ensuring Uber Freight's Billing process operates as efficiently as possible.
