Overview:
At Valence, we are all about building potential. That goes for our clients as well as our team members. Our mission is to help our customers advance their digital transformation journey and we are looking for a Business Analyst to join our team.

Are you passionate about exploring new and emerging technologies and how they can be used to solve challenging problems? If so, then this may be the right opportunity for you. As a Business Analyst at Valence, you will work alongside a group of talented engineers, project managers and analysts defining and implementing end-to-end, leading-edge solutions for our enterprise clients. With Valence, you can work in a collaborative environment where you can influence direction and see the impacts of your contributions. We love to innovate and are looking for people with a passion for learning and growing their technical skills.

In this role, you will:
Assist in goal setting thru the building of accurate program targets & forecasts, supporting reporting and insights in line with forecasts, helping derive actionable insights to manage positive changes in business.

Weekly reporting on key performance indicators for run of business with key insights and actions.

Advise on reporting capabilities for new projects, including innovation releases (launch of new capabilities), and campaigns/product launches. Devise and build reporting plans and drive execution of plans to deliver on reporting needs.

Proactively identify issues in data sources (Power BI, Live Engage, MSX, Adobe Analytics) and partner with appropriate teams to resolve.

Perform market research and stay apprised of digital sales and support trends to inform new business strategies.

derive insights for leadership from the data, understand how it impacts the nuances of the business more than the general consulting recommendations.

Leverage multiple data visualization techniques to land the primary soundbite leaders need to take away, using multiple different methods: PowerPoint, Excel, PowerBI, etc.

Partners with multiple individuals across the organization to gather insight into new data sources, ensure that data is pulled correct, or to drive adoption of a new standard KPI/report.


7+ years working in quantitative or analytical role.

previous experience using Adobe Analytics and Power BI

experience in leveraging PowerPoint and Excel

Ideal candidate would have an eCommerce sales or marketing measurement background.

WHAT WILL MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL AT VALENCE?

Self-starter and independent worker

Must be comfortable with a fast moving, ever-changing environment.

Detail oriented to ensure storytelling skills.

Professional communication skills, including providing status updates to the client.

Successful interacting with multiple stakeholders across organization

You have a passion for innovation and technology. You have a sense of humor. You believe in the potential in everyone. You are ego-free. You're collaborative and value a work culture where great ideas can come from anyone.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Ready to work for OS National LLC?
Are you intrigued by the thought of revolutionizing a trillion-dollar industry? Do you want to be part of a cutting-edge company that is customer-obsessed? A company growing at lightning speed that is full of opportunity? If so, we seek smart, customer-focused, and energetic professionals to join our team to help us to the next level of excellence!

Currently, we have a need for a Business Operations Analyst. The Business Operations Associate is a strong, independent self-starter who is passionate about the continuous improvement of operational workflows and processes. You have a knack for identifying process breaks or operational inefficiencies and working either collaboratively or independently to develop creative solutions to solve such breaks. You understand and can execute against the principles of project management, including influencing cross-functional stakeholders as well as managing organizational change.

Who You Are
The Business Operations Analyst uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve processes, policies, services, and practices. He/She is responsible for maintaining the pricing, discounting, and incentive data to ensure correct pricing and discounting is applied in the ordering tools. The individual will serve as point of contact for managing, tracking, reporting and resolving issues with the pricing and discounting data. What You'll Do
Perform data analysis using specialized domain knowledge and developed business expertise
Develop and lead business analysis programs, initiatives, and activities
Identify problems that impact ability to deliver, ability to achieve margins, or are areas of inconsistency in the business
Develop recommendations for new business processes and adaption of business tools in support of changes
Cross functional collaboration required to execute on tasks The right candidate should have the ability to:
Solve a range of problems and explain logic or decisions to others
Analyze multiple sources of information and evaluate several alternative solutions before confirming path forward
Exchange ideas, content, and explain information in a clear and effective manner
Understand Cisco business model – know how Cisco sells, the Cisco product portfolio and GTM strategies
Interpret large raw data sets; conduct data analysis and audits – high level of Excel mastery (Macros, Pivots, Formulas and Slicing), ability to work through large data and understand reporting
Use reporting tools, download data, and analyse data
Communicate effectively with excellent communication skills, bold, assertive and possess a sense of ownership of the assigned tasks
Work independently and in a cross functional team environment Eligibility & Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree


2 years of overall analyst experience (mandatory)
1 year of relevant experience (desirable)
Highly organized with strong analytical and problem solving skills
Responsive and timely in delivering on commitments

Positive attitude and strong work ethic
Knowledge of Cisco products and services (desired) Who You'll Work With
The Business Operations Analyst works with internal Cisco stakeholders to support setup and maintenance of operational ordering setups.

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Overview
Varonis is a world-class organization with a straightforward mission: protecting vulnerable data.
Did you know that on average, 20% of an organization's data is accessible to every employee? Seventy percent of attacks take months or years to discover. But not for our customers.
At Varonis, we see the world of cybersecurity differently.
Our customers always know where their most valuable data is – on premises or in the cloud. Only the right people have access to only the right data. With real-time awareness of how employees use data, our clients flag and stop malicious behavior in its tracks.
We’re fighting a different battle than conventional cybersecurity companies, relentlessly focused on securing data. Data assets are the most valuable – and vulnerable – components of the global economy. Along with employees, data is at the heart of almost every organization, yet conventional cybersecurity solutions, by themselves, have failed to protect it.

Ensure business is transferred over to TWS underwriter monthly, troubleshoot & resolve rejected business.
Reconcile large sets of data between two systems.
Liaise with the Implementation team and/or underwriter for any issues that require their input/set-ups.
Manage pricing changes by liaising with management and underwriter, identify requirements, coordinate changes across several team members, verify changes and plan implementation and testing.
Ability to identify pricing trends & perform basic mathematical calculations to address pricing requests and make recommendation.
Develop and manage a tracking system for pricing changes across several products.
Liaise with inhouse SQL developers to automate rate calculations and implement efficiencies.
Complete user acceptance testing for areas of responsibility as required.
Understand system functionality of several modules impacting sales, claims, accounting, and reinsurance.
Review business requirements with department managers and liaise with system provider to ensure changes/enhancements are made to meet needs.
Develop ad-hoc reporting for stakeholders and management.
Ability to effectively communicate with and present information to stakeholders at all levels, internally & externally.
Ability to develop professional relationships with internal and external customers.
Willing to assist other departments with tasks as and when required.
Must thrive in a fast-paced environment and be able to work independently and as a member of a team.
Must be comfortable working with continuously changing priorities.
Must be able to sit for long periods of time, bend, stoop and lift to 25 lbs.
Special projects as assigned by immediate supervisor.
There are no travel requirements for this role

Overview:
At Valence, we are all about building potential. That goes for our clients as well as our team members. Our mission is to help our customers advance their digital transformation journey and we are looking for a Business Analyst to join our team.

Are you passionate about exploring new and emerging technologies and how they can be used to solve challenging problems? If so, then this may be the right opportunity for you. As a Business Analyst at Valence, you will work alongside a group of talented engineers, project managers and analysts defining and implementing end-to-end, leading-edge solutions for our enterprise clients. With Valence, you can work in a collaborative environment where you can influence direction and see the impacts of your contributions. We love to innovate and are looking for people with a passion for learning and growing their technical skills.

In this role, you will:
Assist in goal setting thru the building of accurate program targets & forecasts, supporting reporting and insights in line with forecasts, helping derive actionable insights to manage positive changes in business.

Weekly reporting on key performance indicators for run of business with key insights and actions.

Advise on reporting capabilities for new projects, including innovation releases (launch of new capabilities), and campaigns/product launches. Devise and build reporting plans and drive execution of plans to deliver on reporting needs.

Proactively identify issues in data sources (Power BI, Live Engage, MSX, Adobe Analytics) and partner with appropriate teams to resolve.

Perform market research and stay apprised of digital sales and support trends to inform new business strategies.

derive insights for leadership from the data, understand how it impacts the nuances of the business more than the general consulting recommendations.

Leverage multiple data visualization techniques to land the primary soundbite leaders need to take away, using multiple different methods: PowerPoint, Excel, PowerBI, etc.

Partners with multiple individuals across the organization to gather insight into new data sources, ensure that data is pulled correct, or to drive adoption of a new standard KPI/report.


7+ years working in quantitative or analytical role.

previous experience using Adobe Analytics and Power BI

experience in leveraging PowerPoint and Excel

Ideal candidate would have an eCommerce sales or marketing measurement background.

WHAT WILL MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL AT VALENCE?

Self-starter and independent worker

Must be comfortable with a fast moving, ever-changing environment.

Detail oriented to ensure storytelling skills.

Professional communication skills, including providing status updates to the client.

Successful interacting with multiple stakeholders across organization

You have a passion for innovation and technology. You have a sense of humor. You believe in the potential in everyone. You are ego-free. You're collaborative and value a work culture where great ideas can come from anyone.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

POSITION SUMMARY:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through faster, more accurate diagnostic tests. As a member of our team, you’ll get to make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop rapid groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges.

Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics – from ideation and innovation through development and delivery of life-changing advancements in healthcare-associated infections, sexual health, critical infectious disease, virology, and oncology applications.

As part of the Danaher family of companies, our work at Cepheid is supported by a global science and technology innovator. In addition to Danaher’s unrivaled leadership training and professional development programs, this relationship also provides expanded career opportunities across industries and brands. Together, we are united by a shared purpose: Helping Realize Life’s Potential.

The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for helping to establish data-driven decisions by developing, maintaining, and optimizing both business and financial analytics for Customer Care, Americas. The Business Data Analyst will work with partners across the business to help ensure data drives decision making. This is for a high growth company, with rapidly changing priorities and opportunities for continuous improvement. The position requires a person who can manage multiple data activities, and demonstrate flexibility, holistic thinking, time prioritization, and is capable of effectively influencing a variety of stakeholders across the organization.


Become a Subject Matter Expert for our operational data (SFDC, SAP, etc.) by learning and understanding the business, sourcing accurate data, and developing both prescriptive and predictive analytics to help identify and resolve business challenges.
Partner with business leaders to identify, define, develop, and automate key performance metrics that will power data-centered decision making to help us continuously improve.
Build, maintain, and optimize analytical dashboards and models by connecting the dots between large data sets from multiple sources (financial and operational) to deliver actionable business insights and drive business decision-making.
Identify and design process improvements in the organization; automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery/integrity, etc.
Be an innovation advocate to improve the delivery of data to our partners – including making suggestions for the creation of new business dashboards/analytical tools and the refinement of current dashboards for improved data integrity.
Obtaining data from multiple sources, analyze it, and effectively present the data to support or suggest different business objectives
Collaborate closely with other data-focused team members to develop and execute an organizational data strategy.
Ensure effective communications with stakeholders, using a variety of tools and channels
Work independently and confidently handle multiple time-sensitive requests
Other duties as assigned

(REQUIRED)
Complete all assigned and required training satisfactorily and on time


Bachelor’s degree in field with 3-5 years of experience in finance, data analytics, or related field
Knowledge and Skills
Ability to function under pressure and high paced environment – Team player with excellent interpersonal skills, self-motivated, energetic, “can-do” attitude in a fast-moving environment
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Advanced Excel skills with ability to understand and use applied statistics and predictive analytics on complex data sets to solve business problems as well as recommend strategic direction
Experience using data to identify and drive problem solving efforts for operational improvements
Understand data architecture, mapping of data sources and data definitions to ensure quality inputs to analytical solutions.
Proven ability to adapt to change, manage and prioritize work, and communicate effectively in a remote work environment
Proven ability to quickly build trusted relationships across an organization, from SMEs up to Directors, and peers outside of the organization
Ability to learn quickly and pick up tools, systems, and processes in a short amount of time
Experience participating in or leading continuous improvement activities, utilizing structured continuous improvement methodologies (Six Sigma, Problem Solving, Kaizen, and Gemba Walks)


Experience with Einstein Analytics / SFDC to analyze and visualize data reporting
Experience with Power BI or other Business Intelligence/Data Analytics tools

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

About Extend:

Extend is modernizing the $100 billion-per-year extended warranty and protection plan industry using cutting-edge technology, and top-notch customer service. With a $260M Series C round of funding, we are ready to continue to scale our organization and grow beyond our $1.6B valuation.

Our API-first solution allows any merchant to offer extended warranties and protection plans, both online and offline, while also providing a merchant's end customers with a vastly improved and modern support experience that eliminates many of the issues customers face today with legacy underwriters.

We are a venture backed startup based in downtown San Francisco (and since COVID began, fully remote) that is led by founders who have previously had multiple successful exits. Extend is simplifying the technology stack for the extended warranty industry, in the same way that Stripe did for online payments and Affirm did for consumer point of sale financing.

Overview:
At Valence, we are all about building potential. That goes for our clients as well as our team members. Our mission is to help our customers advance their digital transformation journey and we are looking for a Business Analyst to join our team.

Are you passionate about exploring new and emerging technologies and how they can be used to solve challenging problems? If so, then this may be the right opportunity for you. As a Business Analyst at Valence, you will work alongside a group of talented engineers, project managers and analysts defining and implementing end-to-end, leading-edge solutions for our enterprise clients. With Valence, you can work in a collaborative environment where you can influence direction and see the impacts of your contributions. We love to innovate and are looking for people with a passion for learning and growing their technical skills.

In this role, you will:
Assist in goal setting thru the building of accurate program targets & forecasts, supporting reporting and insights in line with forecasts, helping derive actionable insights to manage positive changes in business.

Weekly reporting on key performance indicators for run of business with key insights and actions.

Advise on reporting capabilities for new projects, including innovation releases (launch of new capabilities), and campaigns/product launches. Devise and build reporting plans and drive execution of plans to deliver on reporting needs.

Proactively identify issues in data sources (Power BI, Live Engage, MSX, Adobe Analytics) and partner with appropriate teams to resolve.

Perform market research and stay apprised of digital sales and support trends to inform new business strategies.

derive insights for leadership from the data, understand how it impacts the nuances of the business more than the general consulting recommendations.

Leverage multiple data visualization techniques to land the primary soundbite leaders need to take away, using multiple different methods: PowerPoint, Excel, PowerBI, etc.

Partners with multiple individuals across the organization to gather insight into new data sources, ensure that data is pulled correct, or to drive adoption of a new standard KPI/report.


7+ years working in quantitative or analytical role.

previous experience using Adobe Analytics and Power BI

experience in leveraging PowerPoint and Excel

Ideal candidate would have an eCommerce sales or marketing measurement background.

WHAT WILL MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL AT VALENCE?

Self-starter and independent worker

Must be comfortable with a fast moving, ever-changing environment.

Detail oriented to ensure storytelling skills.

Professional communication skills, including providing status updates to the client.

Successful interacting with multiple stakeholders across organization

You have a passion for innovation and technology. You have a sense of humor. You believe in the potential in everyone. You are ego-free. You're collaborative and value a work culture where great ideas can come from anyone.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Lyra is transforming mental health care through technology with a human touch to help people feel emotionally healthy at work and at home. BuzzFeed

BuzzFeed is the world's leading independent digital media and tech company, with a cross-platform news and entertainment network that reaches hundreds of millions of people globally and spreads Joy and Truth across the internet.
Our portfolio of brands are household names that people rely on to inform and entertain, including: BuzzFeed, BuzzFeed News, Tasty, Nifty, Bring Me, Cocoa Butter, Pero Like, Worth It, and Unsolved to name a few! These properties and their Creators reach over 134M people a month through articles, lists, videos, animations, quizzes, podcasts, original series, newsletters and more.

The Role

The Analyst, Business Operations will play a significant role in BuzzFeed's growing business. We are looking for an exceptional individual to contribute to our efforts in building a reporting suite for sales leaders to understand how to scale the advertising business and create incremental revenue/growth opportunities. The Analyst, Business Operations will report to the Sr. Manager of Business Operations. BuzzFeed is working remotely through at least September 2021, but this role will be tied to our New York City office.

You Will

Coordinate revenue and budgeting processes used within the advertising business; establish high levels of quality, efficiency, and consistency
Conduct analyses to gain a deeper insight into advertising business across all core functions: sales, client service, pricing, creative, ad operations, research, and marketing
Develop and report on the metrics to evaluate efficiency and productivity across business units
Establish effective analysis of advertising business trends and performance to identify greater efficiencies while managing and understanding process bottlenecks throughout the entire sales lifecycle
Assist in maintaining the functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards and reports, and ensuring data integrity throughout our CRM system
Continuously assess resource management and make recommendations to ensure optimal support model
Assess sales trends, client feedback, and market movement; consolidate into recommendations for sales leadership
Perform ad-hoc analysis for senior management providing data that will inform business decisions

You Have

One to two years of digital media experience including internships; could include Finance, Business Operations, Strategy, Sales, Sales Operations, Account Management, Sales Planning, Ad Operations, or Consulting
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets
Strong interpersonal skills
Natural ability to tell a compelling story using data-driven insights
Experience with sales cycles/tools including CRM a plus
Business operations or sales operations experience with a digital and/or technology company a plus

All job applications must be received through the official BuzzFeed Jobs board ( https://www.buzzfeed.com/about/jobs ), including referrals. It is BuzzFeed's practice to not schedule job interviews until after an application is submitted through our jobs board.

Life at BuzzFeed

At BuzzFeed, we believe our work benefits from the diverse perspectives of our employees. As such, BuzzFeed celebrates inclusion and is committed to equal opportunity employment. At BuzzFeed, you can expect:

A supportive, inclusive atmosphere on a team that values your contributions

Opportunities for personal and professional growth through work experience, offerings from our in-house Learning @ BuzzFeed team, our Employee Resource Groups, and more

An attractive and equitable compensation package, including salary and stock options

A generous benefits program featuring PTO, unlimited sick time, comprehensive medical benefits, a family leave policy, access to mental health platforms, retirement plans, gym and wellness discounts, and much more.

BuzzFeed is the world's leading tech-powered media company, with a cross-platform news and entertainment network that reaches hundreds of millions of people globally. The company aims to spread truth and joy across the internet by producing articles, lists, quizzes, videos, original series; lifestyle content through brands including Tasty, the world's largest social food network; original reporting and investigative journalism through BuzzFeed News; strategic partnerships, licensing and product development through BuzzFeed Marketing; and original productions across broadcast, cable, SVOD, film and digital platforms for BuzzFeed Studios.

BuzzFeed is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any other protected category.

About FedEx Supply Chain
FedEx Supply Chain, a subsidiary of FedEx Corp. (NYSE: FDX), is a leader in the third-party logistics industry offering a diverse service portfolio that enables commerce for businesses. With a proven track record of innovation and operational excellence, FedEx Supply Chain takes a consultative approach to optimize logistics processes, implement innovative technology and drive continuous improvement. By leveraging best practices and the world-renowned FedEx network, FedEx Supply Chain delivers leading solutions that provide flexibility, enable scalability and improve cost-effectiveness for customers. Through more than 11,000 employees, 130 operations and 35 million square feet of warehouse space, FedEx Supply Chain manages nearly 150 million packages and processes 358 million returns each year. For more information, go to supplychain.fedex.com.

POSITION SUMMARY:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through faster, more accurate diagnostic tests. As a member of our team, you’ll get to make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop rapid groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges.

Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics – from ideation and innovation through development and delivery of life-changing advancements in healthcare-associated infections, sexual health, critical infectious disease, virology, and oncology applications.

As part of the Danaher family of companies, our work at Cepheid is supported by a global science and technology innovator. In addition to Danaher’s unrivaled leadership training and professional development programs, this relationship also provides expanded career opportunities across industries and brands. Together, we are united by a shared purpose: Helping Realize Life’s Potential.

The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for helping to establish data-driven decisions by developing, maintaining, and optimizing both business and financial analytics for Customer Care, Americas. The Business Data Analyst will work with partners across the business to help ensure data drives decision making. This is for a high growth company, with rapidly changing priorities and opportunities for continuous improvement. The position requires a person who can manage multiple data activities, and demonstrate flexibility, holistic thinking, time prioritization, and is capable of effectively influencing a variety of stakeholders across the organization.


Become a Subject Matter Expert for our operational data (SFDC, SAP, etc.) by learning and understanding the business, sourcing accurate data, and developing both prescriptive and predictive analytics to help identify and resolve business challenges.
Partner with business leaders to identify, define, develop, and automate key performance metrics that will power data-centered decision making to help us continuously improve.
Build, maintain, and optimize analytical dashboards and models by connecting the dots between large data sets from multiple sources (financial and operational) to deliver actionable business insights and drive business decision-making.
Identify and design process improvements in the organization; automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery/integrity, etc.
Be an innovation advocate to improve the delivery of data to our partners – including making suggestions for the creation of new business dashboards/analytical tools and the refinement of current dashboards for improved data integrity.
Obtaining data from multiple sources, analyze it, and effectively present the data to support or suggest different business objectives
Collaborate closely with other data-focused team members to develop and execute an organizational data strategy.
Ensure effective communications with stakeholders, using a variety of tools and channels
Work independently and confidently handle multiple time-sensitive requests

POSITION SUMMARY:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through faster, more accurate diagnostic tests. As a member of our team, you’ll get to make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop rapid groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges.

Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics – from ideation and innovation through development and delivery of life-changing advancements in healthcare-associated infections, sexual health, critical infectious disease, virology, and oncology applications.

As part of the Danaher family of companies, our work at Cepheid is supported by a global science and technology innovator. In addition to Danaher’s unrivaled leadership training and professional development programs, this relationship also provides expanded career opportunities across industries and brands. Together, we are united by a shared purpose: Helping Realize Life’s Potential.

The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for helping to establish data-driven decisions by developing, maintaining, and optimizing both business and financial analytics for Customer Care, Americas. The Business Data Analyst will work with partners across the business to help ensure data drives decision making. This is for a high growth company, with rapidly changing priorities and opportunities for continuous improvement. The position requires a person who can manage multiple data activities, and demonstrate flexibility, holistic thinking, time prioritization, and is capable of effectively influencing a variety of stakeholders across the organization.


Become a Subject Matter Expert for our operational data (SFDC, SAP, etc.) by learning and understanding the business, sourcing accurate data, and developing both prescriptive and predictive analytics to help identify and resolve business challenges.
Partner with business leaders to identify, define, develop, and automate key performance metrics that will power data-centered decision making to help us continuously improve.
Build, maintain, and optimize analytical dashboards and models by connecting the dots between large data sets from multiple sources (financial and operational) to deliver actionable business insights and drive business decision-making.
Identify and design process improvements in the organization; automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery/integrity, etc.
Be an innovation advocate to improve the delivery of data to our partners – including making suggestions for the creation of new business dashboards/analytical tools and the refinement of current dashboards for improved data integrity.
Obtaining data from multiple sources, analyze it, and effectively present the data to support or suggest different business objectives
Collaborate closely with other data-focused team members to develop and execute an organizational data strategy.
Ensure effective communications with stakeholders, using a variety of tools and channels
Work independently and confidently handle multiple time-sensitive requests

Job Summary
Plays an important part in optimizing existing business processes and improving agency growth.
Responsible for obtaining and evaluating information that supports revenue growth and profitability.

Who You Are
The Business Operations Analyst uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve processes, policies, services, and practices. He/She is responsible for maintaining the pricing, discounting, and incentive data to ensure correct pricing and discounting is applied in the ordering tools. The individual will serve as point of contact for managing, tracking, reporting and resolving issues with the pricing and discounting data. What You'll Do
Perform data analysis using specialized domain knowledge and developed business expertise
Develop and lead business analysis programs, initiatives, and activities
Identify problems that impact ability to deliver, ability to achieve margins, or are areas of inconsistency in the business
Develop recommendations for new business processes and adaption of business tools in support of changes
Cross functional collaboration required to execute on tasks The right candidate should have the ability to:
Solve a range of problems and explain logic or decisions to others
Analyze multiple sources of information and evaluate several alternative solutions before confirming path forward
Exchange ideas, content, and explain information in a clear and effective manner
Understand Cisco business model – know how Cisco sells, the Cisco product portfolio and GTM strategies
Interpret large raw data sets; conduct data analysis and audits – high level of Excel mastery (Macros, Pivots, Formulas and Slicing), ability to work through large data and understand reporting
Use reporting tools, download data, and analyse data
Communicate effectively with excellent communication skills, bold, assertive and possess a sense of ownership of the assigned tasks
Work independently and in a cross functional team environment Eligibility & Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree


2 years of overall analyst experience (mandatory)
1 year of relevant experience (desirable)
Highly organized with strong analytical and problem solving skills
Responsive and timely in delivering on commitments
Knowledgeable in process and change management
Positive attitude and strong work ethic
Knowledge of Cisco products and services (desired) Who You'll Work With
The Business Operations Analyst works with internal Cisco stakeholders to support setup and maintenance of operational ordering setups.

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Business Process Analyst -UND0003N9
Description

Job Summary

Under broad supervision provides process and project support to the business in the development of on-going process and policy assessment evaluation improvement and compliance to support business initiatives and strategies.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Assists with the development and compliance of policies and procedures for the business to ensure consistent implementation and improve efficiency cost-effectiveness and/or internal and external customer service. Understands the business needs and consults and partners with business leaders in helping to plan projects and programs.
Participates in the analysis and decision support to help the business deliver on key business priorities. Interacts and collaborates with multiple disciplines to gather information perform analysis and assist with making recommendations to management to drive continuous improvement.
Provides input in defining process performance measures determines data availability advises operational reporting group of required measures and helps with developing methods and tools to track process performance.
Assists with developing process-related training programs including creating workflow job aids training materials and presentations related to internal and external learning opportunities. Evaluates alternatives and external training.
Partners with the appropriate team for building and maintaining centralized processing documentation. Evaluates content for reference library for their area of responsibility. Maintains inventory of business process methodologies and approach. Documents business processes by applying and promoting process modeling best practices.
May assist other business project managers for process improvement projects including assisting IT with setting requirements participating in user acceptance testing and documenting processes.
May work with business partners across organization to improve how operations metrics are gathered stored and analyzed. Helps prepare operations finance and statistical reports using relevant internal and external data.

EverCommerce is looking for a Business Analyst to join our team. The Business Analyst will play a key role and support the VP of Strategic Planning & Analytics, General Managers, Executive Team, and other key stakeholders in a variety of projects, including KPI development, analysis and tracking, executive-level reporting/visualization, data infrastructure build across a diverse portfolio of businesses, and deep one-off operational analyses.
You:
You are a collaborative, enthusiastic, high-performing individual with a “no job too small” attitude. You’re driven by deadlines and enjoy working in a fast paced, continually changing environment with other like-minded individuals. You love teams but also enjoy putting your head down and getting things done with your headphones on. You are highly self-motivated and can initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance because you have confidence to ask questions and work independently.

Position Purpose:
Perform various analysis and interpretation to link business needs and objectives for assigned function
Support business initiatives through data analysis, identification of implementation barriers and user acceptance testing of new systems
Identify and analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to improve existing processes
Perform detailed analysis on assigned projects, recommend potential business solutions and assist with implementation
Identify ways to enhance performance management and operational reports related to new business implementation processes

About FedEx Supply Chain
FedEx Supply Chain, a subsidiary of FedEx Corp. (NYSE: FDX), is a leader in the third-party logistics industry offering a diverse service portfolio that enables commerce for businesses. With a proven track record of innovation and operational excellence, FedEx Supply Chain takes a consultative approach to optimize logistics processes, implement innovative technology and drive continuous improvement. By leveraging best practices and the world-renowned FedEx network, FedEx Supply Chain delivers leading solutions that provide flexibility, enable scalability and improve cost-effectiveness for customers. Through more than 11,000 employees, 130 operations and 35 million square feet of warehouse space, FedEx Supply Chain manages nearly 150 million packages and processes 358 million returns each year. For more information, go to supplychain.fedex.com.

We Have….
A strong FedEx brand consistently ranked among the world’s most admired and trusted employers.

The Department of Public Works and Environmental Services, a nationally accredited agency committed to building and maintaining safe, reliable infrastructure that improves public health and provides a high quality of life for residents, is seeking an experienced and innovative business analyst to join the IT services team supporting the Capital Facilities division. An exciting initiative is underway to implement an innovative SaaS capital project management technology, providing an excellent opportunity for a qualified candidate to help modernize processes supporting both customers and employees.

As a member of the team, you will:
Serve as the lead business analyst point of contact to Capital Facilities division and have overall responsibility and accountability for development and delivery of high-quality IT solutions and services.

In Finance, we work hand-in-hand with leaders across the company to ensure smooth, disciplined execution of strategic business objectives. Our Accounting team builds scalable, controlled processes and products for Global Accounting, Treasury, and FinTech that enable our business to operate efficiently.
About the Role
This role is responsible for ensuring Uber Freight's Billing process operates as efficiently as possible. The successful candidate will be responsible for implementing all billing processes and controls, ensuring the BPO processes are maintained, invoice submissions are correct, timely, and accurate. In addition to owning Uber's AR onboarding process for new shippers. The role will also work on payment options and collections for large freight customers.

POSITION SUMMARY
The business analyst will focus on understanding the business operations and process in relation to the financial support area of the US Autoforce Division. They will work closely with the business unit and technology group team to address the tactical day-to-day aspects of discovering, validating, documenting and communicating business-process-related knowledge through modeling, simulating and analyzing current and future states. This will include a heavy focus on mapping and implementing these processes in the businesses new D365 / ERP platform.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Confers with process owners within the business to analyze current operational procedures, identify areas for improvement, and offer possible solutions
Identifies and drives to completion new opportunities for process improvement

You will be a critical business partner to the organization, helping cross-functional partners in marketing, product, etc. You are creative, excel in building productive and positive partnerships with partners, are customer-centric, and know where and how to influence positive optimizations and improvements within the business space.

Duties and Responsibilities

Example Achievements You May Make

Build a single source of truth for marketing channel metrics, attribution, and downstream business funnel metrics, in partnership with people across Product, Marketing, Operations, and other teams.

Overview:
At Valence, we are all about building potential. That goes for our clients as well as our team members. Our mission is to help our customers advance their digital transformation journey and we are looking for a Business Analyst to join our team.

Are you passionate about exploring new and emerging technologies and how they can be used to solve challenging problems? If so, then this may be the right opportunity for you. As a Business Analyst at Valence, you will work alongside a group of talented engineers, project managers and analysts defining and implementing end-to-end, leading-edge solutions for our enterprise clients. With Valence, you can work in a collaborative environment where you can influence direction and see the impacts of your contributions. We love to innovate and are looking for people with a passion for learning and growing their technical skills.

In this role, you will:
Assist in goal setting thru the building of accurate program targets & forecasts, supporting reporting and insights in line with forecasts, helping derive actionable insights to manage positive changes in business.

Weekly reporting on key performance indicators for run of business with key insights and actions.

Advise on reporting capabilities for new projects, including innovation releases (launch of new capabilities), and campaigns/product launches. Devise and build reporting plans and drive execution of plans to deliver on reporting needs.

Proactively identify issues in data sources (Power BI, Live Engage, MSX, Adobe Analytics) and partner with appropriate teams to resolve.

Perform market research and stay apprised of digital sales and support trends to inform new business strategies.

derive insights for leadership from the data, understand how it impacts the nuances of the business more than the general consulting recommendations.

Leverage multiple data visualization techniques to land the primary soundbite leaders need to take away, using multiple different methods: PowerPoint, Excel, PowerBI, etc.

Partners with multiple individuals across the organization to gather insight into new data sources, ensure that data is pulled correct, or to drive adoption of a new standard KPI/report.


7+ years working in quantitative or analytical role.

previous experience using Adobe Analytics and Power BI

experience in leveraging PowerPoint and Excel

Ideal candidate would have an eCommerce sales or marketing measurement background.

WHAT WILL MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL AT VALENCE?

Self-starter and independent worker

Must be comfortable with a fast moving, ever-changing environment.

Detail oriented to ensure storytelling skills.

Professional communication skills, including providing status updates to the client.

Successful interacting with multiple stakeholders across organization

You have a passion for innovation and technology. You have a sense of humor. You believe in the potential in everyone. You are ego-free. You're collaborative and value a work culture where great ideas can come from anyone.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Job Description:

JOB SUMMARY/PURPOSE
Provides and leads reporting and analysis in multiple areas within SHP. Provides leadership with trend analysis, data visualization, and explanations to support decision making. Maintains reports and dashboards and/or assists with development of automated dashboards. Supports projects, process improvement, audits, and regulatory reporting efforts.
DEPARTMENT DESCRIPTION
Samaritan Health Plans (SHP) operates a portfolio of health plan products under several different legal structures: InterCommunity Health Plans, Inc. (IHN) is designated as a regional Coordinated Care Organization (CCO) for Medicaid beneficiaries; Samaritan Health Plans, Inc. offers Medicare Advantage, Commercial Large Group, and Commercial Large Group PPO and EPO plans; SHP is also the third-party administrator for Samaritan Health Services’ self-funded employee health benefit plan. As part of an Integrated Delivery System, Samaritan Health Plans is strategically and operationally aligned with Samaritan Health Services’ mission of Building Healthier Communities Together.















Location: Samaritan Health Services · SHS Health Plan Ops - Finance
Schedule: 1.0 (80 hrs/pp), Day

About Us:
Strata Solar is a national leading developer of commercial and utility-scale solar farms ranked amongst the top five solar producers in the US. We understand that our employees are the lifeblood of the company. We strive to align company goals with those of our employees. We're constantly innovating to make a difference for our customers, our employees, and our planet. Our mission is to make a difference by developing cost-efficient alternatives to traditional energy sources, without long-term dependence on government subsidies. We’re leading the industry in sustainable energy careers. We hope you’ll join us.

About HealthSmart
HealthSmart is the premier provider of customizable and scalable health plan solutions for self-funded employers. We reduce costs and improve outcomes, all the while treating our health plan members with dignity and respect. But that's just the beginning of our story - We make differences in peoples' lives every single day!
Our HealthSmart team understands the difference we make when treating others with dignity and respect, which is why we embody our mission by promoting a diverse and inclusive culture.
We're a company of innovators.
We deliver health benefit plans and solutions to provide worry-free, self-funded plan administration, quality coverage, and innovative care.

Operations Associate
Overview
Varonis is a world-class organization with a straightforward mission: protecting vulnerable data.
Did you know that on average, 20% of an organization's data is accessible to every employee? Seventy percent of attacks take months or years to discover. But not for our customers.
At Varonis, we see the world of cybersecurity differently.
Our customers always know where their most valuable data is – on premises or in the cloud. Only the right people have access to only the right data. With real-time awareness of how employees use data, our clients flag and stop malicious behavior in its tracks.
We’re fighting a different battle than conventional cybersecurity companies, relentlessly focused on securing data. Data assets are the most valuable – and vulnerable – components of the global economy. Along with employees, data is at the heart of almost every organization, yet conventional cybersecurity solutions, by themselves, have failed to protect it.

Location: Washington D.C.
Job Description
The Business Process Analyst shall gather and analyze business requirements. The Contractor shall conduct research and analysis to support procurement requirements. The Contractor shall create documents to support the assigned tasks.
Work closely with the Government to identify and analyze core business processes and workflow.
Document processes and workflows.
Develop a clear and detailed process maps and business requirements.
Identify issues and risks.

EverCommerce is looking for a Business Analyst to join our team. The Business Analyst will play a key role and support the VP of Strategic Planning & Analytics, General Managers, Executive Team, and other key stakeholders in a variety of projects, including KPI development, analysis and tracking, executive-level reporting/visualization, data infrastructure build across a diverse portfolio of businesses, and deep one-off operational analyses.
You:
You are a collaborative, enthusiastic, high-performing individual with a “no job too small” attitude. You’re driven by deadlines and enjoy working in a fast paced, continually changing environment with other like-minded individuals. You love teams but also enjoy putting your head down and getting things done with your headphones on. You are highly self-motivated and can initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance because you have confidence to ask questions and work independently.

Our people define our company. AM Retail Group associates are smart, ambitious, engaging & fun people, who strive for excellence in everything they do. Working here requires commitment, innovation, & flexibility. The entrepreneurial drive of our associates is at the heart of our quest to improve & innovate.

We have an immediate opening for an energetic, passionate & experienced full time professional to join our eCommerce team as an eCommerce Business Analyst.

This position will support all AM Retail Group eCommerce websites (DKNY, Karl Lagerfeld Paris, Andrew Marc, Wilsons Leather, G.H. Bass & Co.) by performing reporting and analytical activities to help the business monitor key success metrics and identify opportunities for growth.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Who You Are
The Business Operations Analyst uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve processes, policies, services, and practices. He/She is responsible for maintaining the pricing, discounting, and incentive data to ensure correct pricing and discounting is applied in the ordering tools. The individual will serve as point of contact for managing, tracking, reporting and resolving issues with the pricing and discounting data. What You'll Do
Perform data analysis using specialized domain knowledge and developed business expertise
Develop and lead business analysis programs, initiatives, and activities
Identify problems that impact ability to deliver, ability to achieve margins, or are areas of inconsistency in the business
Develop recommendations for new business processes and adaption of business tools in support of changes
Cross functional collaboration required to execute on tasks The right candidate should have the ability to:
Solve a range of problems and explain logic or decisions to others
Analyze multiple sources of information and evaluate several alternative solutions before confirming path forward
Exchange ideas, content, and explain information in a clear and effective manner
Understand Cisco business model – know how Cisco sells, the Cisco product portfolio and GTM strategies
Interpret large raw data sets; conduct data analysis and audits – high level of Excel mastery (Macros, Pivots, Formulas and Slicing), ability to work through large data and understand reporting
Use reporting tools, download data, and analyse data
Communicate effectively with excellent communication skills, bold, assertive and possess a sense of ownership of the assigned tasks
Work independently and in a cross functional team environment Eligibility & Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree


2 years of overall analyst experience (mandatory)
1 year of relevant experience (desirable)
Highly organized with strong analytical and problem solving skills
Responsive and timely in delivering on commitments
Knowledgeable in process and change management
Positive attitude and strong work ethic
Knowledge of Cisco products and services (desired) Who You'll Work With
The Business Operations Analyst works with internal Cisco stakeholders to support setup and maintenance of operational ordering setups.

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Operations Associate
Overview
Varonis is a world-class organization with a straightforward mission: protecting vulnerable data.
Did you know that on average, 20% of an organization's data is accessible to every employee? Seventy percent of attacks take months or years to discover. But not for our customers.
At Varonis, we see the world of cybersecurity differently.
Our customers always know where their most valuable data is – on premises or in the cloud. Only the right people have access to only the right data. With real-time awareness of how employees use data, our clients flag and stop malicious behavior in its tracks.
We’re fighting a different battle than conventional cybersecurity companies, relentlessly focused on securing data. Data assets are the most valuable – and vulnerable – components of the global economy. Along with employees, data is at the heart of almost every organization, yet conventional cybersecurity solutions, by themselves, have failed to protect it.

Job Description
This position performs basic project accounting activities and assumes responsibility for maintenance of project-related ledger accounts.

Understand the Prime Contract commercial terms
Understand the activities being performed with respect to engineering and construction accounting methodology and company practices
Learn the required tasks and follow established written procedures and techniques to accomplish project accounting activities
Support and lead invoicing
Reconcile cost, hours, and billing

You will be a critical business partner to the organization, helping cross-functional partners in marketing, product, etc. You are creative, excel in building productive and positive partnerships with partners, are customer-centric, and know where and how to influence positive optimizations and improvements within the business space.

Duties and Responsibilities

Example Achievements You May Make

Build a single source of truth for marketing channel metrics, attribution, and downstream business funnel metrics, in partnership with people across Product, Marketing, Operations, and other teams.

The Data Analytics Reporting Team (DART) MIS Evergreen Process is a collaborative effort between the MIS and business operations teams to validate that appropriate documentation and business approvals exist for reports in accordance with the Intelligence Solutions Standard (ISS). Internal MIS Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) also need to be reviewed to confirm that they adequately reflect the current MIS processes. As a MIS Business Analyst, you will be part of a team responsible for, but not limited to, the following:
Review and confirm all items have required documentation
Confirm that reports and internal department procedures are performing as business expected/documented
Determine if reports and internal department procedures should remain active or need to be decommissioned
Confirm all documentation receives proper approval from Business Operations Management




Preferred:
Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America's households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

Job Description:
Proficient Business Analyst (BA) with experience in government healthcare programs (Medicare Advantage, Medicaid, etc.) systems and processes, developing design solutions and understand cloud computing.
Work at the direction of BCBSA.
Assist with the assessment of existing requirements and document additional requirements for Medicare Advantage Coordination of Care program.

About the role:
The Business Operations Analyst will directly support one of Enova's core businesses and work on projects focused on monitoring and supervision across our products. Enova offers a variety of products across different states and each product - state combination comes with unique regulatory and business needs. The analyst will work cross functionally with different groups of the business on aligning business and compliance requirements, identifying and preventing customer incidents, and collaborating on customer remediations.

What you'll be doing:
Understand, document and become subject matter expert of product offerings, brand and state compliance matrix, product transactional logic, funding and payment processes

Support customer complaint escalation process and complaint data analysis. Recommended process improvements based on observed trends

Develop new and improved monitoring infrastructure to ensure product, technology, and process compliance with internal and regulatory guidelines

Detect production or compliance exceptions, determine impact to business and customers, resolve such exceptions or escalate to management team if needed

Support ad hoc data requests for external / third party business audits


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business, or Finance

1 -2 years of experience in a related field

Skilled in SQL, Python, Excel

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills

Being able to work in a team environment and independently

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Familiarity with Microstrategy, Grafana, and other monitoring dashboards is a plus


Enova's Strategy & Operation teams - or "S&O" as insiders commonly refer to them here - drive the business at both the operational and business levels. In addition to working cross functionally on the corporate side, S&Os work closely with our call center operations (think application support, loan processing, collections or customer service) to ensure optimization and anticipate any bumps in the road. To do this, they dive deeper into our existing processes and ask themselves lots of questions like, why are we doing this that way? Why don't we try this? And, likely the most important question, how is this going to affect the bottom line of our business?


Enova is a leading financial technology company providing online financial services through its AI and machine learning powered lending platform. Enova serves the needs of non-prime consumers and small businesses, who are frequently underserved by traditional banks. Enova has provided more than 7 million customers with over $40 billion in loans and financing with market leading products that provide a path for them to improve their financial health. Want to learn more? Just ask any of our almost 1,500 employees.

Our goal at Enova, we believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all persons and not discriminate in employment decisions by placing the most qualified person in each job, without regard to any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. California Applicants: Click here to review our California Privacy Policy for Job Applicants.

The Department of Public Works and Environmental Services, a nationally accredited agency committed to building and maintaining safe, reliable infrastructure that improves public health and provides a high quality of life for residents, is seeking an experienced and innovative business analyst to join the IT services team supporting the Capital Facilities division. An exciting initiative is underway to implement an innovative SaaS capital project management technology, providing an excellent opportunity for a qualified candidate to help modernize processes supporting both customers and employees.

As a member of the team, you will:
Serve as the lead business analyst point of contact to Capital Facilities division and have overall responsibility and accountability for development and delivery of high-quality IT solutions and services.

The Business Process Analyst shall gather and analyze business requirements. The Contractor shall conduct research and analysis to support procurement requirements. The Contractor shall create documents to support the assigned tasks.
Work closely with the Government to identify and analyze core business processes and workflow.
Document processes and workflows.
Develop a clear and detailed process maps and business requirements.
Identify issues and risks.

EverCommerce is looking for a Business Analyst to join our team. The Business Analyst will play a key role and support the VP of Strategic Planning & Analytics, General Managers, Executive Team, and other key stakeholders in a variety of projects, including KPI development, analysis and tracking, executive-level reporting/visualization, data infrastructure build across a diverse portfolio of businesses, and deep one-off operational analyses.
You:
You are a collaborative, enthusiastic, high-performing individual with a “no job too small” attitude. You’re driven by deadlines and enjoy working in a fast paced, continually changing environment with other like-minded individuals. You love teams but also enjoy putting your head down and getting things done with your headphones on. You are highly self-motivated and can initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance because you have confidence to ask questions and work independently.

As a Revenue Operations Analyst, you would be responsible for partnering and supporting Yelp’s Multi-Location sales groups to help connect data with sales processes, distribution of accounts, and revenue/compensation initiatives. Focus includes custom reporting and analyses, data stewardship/automation, and project management on all things revenue operations. A successful Revenue Operations Analyst will be able to establish autonomy, provide effective technical solutions, and broaden visibility and teamwork with business partners. Our team is customer oriented, focused on helping sales attain and surpass their goals.

This is a full-time role based in the US.
Where you come in:
You will work with a variety of stakeholders including corporate infrastructure, sales leadership, Business Operations, and FP&A to understand what visibility Yelp needs into sales performance and planning

Job Summary:
The Business Process Analyst will own and support key foundational excel tools/reports and systems that serve as core pieces of the company’s merchandising and planning capabilities. He/She must have retail knowledge and experience to understand business needs; the technical skillset to support merchandising/planning systems (JDA MFP/APT); advanced Excel and VBA skills to transform data and automate reports and tools. He/She will also need project management and collaboration skills to drive execution in a fast-paced environment of changing and often competing priorities. This position will report to the Manager of Business Process.

POSITION SUMMARY
The business analyst will focus on understanding the business operations and process in relation to the financial support area of the US Autoforce Division. They will work closely with the business unit and technology group team to address the tactical day-to-day aspects of discovering, validating, documenting and communicating business-process-related knowledge through modeling, simulating and analyzing current and future states. This will include a heavy focus on mapping and implementing these processes in the businesses new D365 / ERP platform.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Confers with process owners within the business to analyze current operational procedures, identify areas for improvement, and offer possible solutions
Identifies and drives to completion new opportunities for process improvement

Operations Associate
Overview
Varonis is a world-class organization with a straightforward mission: protecting vulnerable data.
Did you know that on average, 20% of an organization's data is accessible to every employee? Seventy percent of attacks take months or years to discover. But not for our customers.
At Varonis, we see the world of cybersecurity differently.
Our customers always know where their most valuable data is – on premises or in the cloud. Only the right people have access to only the right data. With real-time awareness of how employees use data, our clients flag and stop malicious behavior in its tracks.
We’re fighting a different battle than conventional cybersecurity companies, relentlessly focused on securing data. Data assets are the most valuable – and vulnerable – components of the global economy. Along with employees, data is at the heart of almost every organization, yet conventional cybersecurity solutions, by themselves, have failed to protect it.

Overview:
At Valence, we are all about building potential. That goes for our clients as well as our team members. Our mission is to help our customers advance their digital transformation journey and we are looking for a Business Analyst to join our team.

Are you passionate about exploring new and emerging technologies and how they can be used to solve challenging problems? If so, then this may be the right opportunity for you. As a Business Analyst at Valence, you will work alongside a group of talented engineers, project managers and analysts defining and implementing end-to-end, leading-edge solutions for our enterprise clients. With Valence, you can work in a collaborative environment where you can influence direction and see the impacts of your contributions. We love to innovate and are looking for people with a passion for learning and growing their technical skills.

In this role, you will:
Assist in goal setting thru the building of accurate program targets & forecasts, supporting reporting and insights in line with forecasts, helping derive actionable insights to manage positive changes in business.

Weekly reporting on key performance indicators for run of business with key insights and actions.

Advise on reporting capabilities for new projects, including innovation releases (launch of new capabilities), and campaigns/product launches. Devise and build reporting plans and drive execution of plans to deliver on reporting needs.

Proactively identify issues in data sources (Power BI, Live Engage, MSX, Adobe Analytics) and partner with appropriate teams to resolve.

Perform market research and stay apprised of digital sales and support trends to inform new business strategies.

derive insights for leadership from the data, understand how it impacts the nuances of the business more than the general consulting recommendations.

Leverage multiple data visualization techniques to land the primary soundbite leaders need to take away, using multiple different methods: PowerPoint, Excel, PowerBI, etc.

Partners with multiple individuals across the organization to gather insight into new data sources, ensure that data is pulled correct, or to drive adoption of a new standard KPI/report.


7+ years working in quantitative or analytical role.

previous experience using Adobe Analytics and Power BI

experience in leveraging PowerPoint and Excel

Ideal candidate would have an eCommerce sales or marketing measurement background.

WHAT WILL MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL AT VALENCE?

Self-starter and independent worker

Must be comfortable with a fast moving, ever-changing environment.

Detail oriented to ensure storytelling skills.

Professional communication skills, including providing status updates to the client.

Successful interacting with multiple stakeholders across organization

You have a passion for innovation and technology. You have a sense of humor. You believe in the potential in everyone. You are ego-free. You're collaborative and value a work culture where great ideas can come from anyone.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.
